title: Phone Background Processing notification
content:
The phone and messaging apps are frequently displays a notification in the  notifications bar stating that it is background processing. They usually show up for a couple seconds and then disappear but it is happening all the time and is extremely frustrating. 

I have not been able to figure out any way to stop it from popping up on my notifications. I have gone into the apps and turned the background processing notification to silent but I want it to stop popping up in my notifications all together but it still shows up all the time. This wasn't happening before I updated Android 11 recently.


Nothing I've tried has worked, the only option would be for me to disable all silent notifications but I have other silent notifications that I need to see in this is not unacceptable "solution."

I have not seen an option to disable the background processing notification from showing up. I have Googled and browed the community forums several times and still have not been able to find to a solution and this needs to be fixed ASAP. Android 11 has a ton of glitches and issues that has made my phone virtually unusable half of the time and it is extremely frustrating; this is just one of many things but it should be easily fixable and yet I cannot figure out how to get it to stop popping up. 

I will try to get a screenshot next time it happens but it only shows up for a few seconds and then disappears so it's difficult to get a screenshot.
